Preterit Intransitive.text: azzele laʕ=ʕanebər d-u=zād, ḥǝ́lla-lle ko-hawən qaṭmo, mʕafnakke bayəq w azzé ʻer ging zu den Getreidespeichern ; da sah er, dass sie zu Asche geworden waren. Das Getreide war schimmelig geworden, und vermodert, und war dahinʼ; 511; 113/18;

MuZ: Hol dmašəkle lu+waziro. Azzé mə́ḷḷalle, mašəkle d̥kǝnne bi+hno, azzé qrélalle. Əmmi, ‘Haw ṭowe ʕal ʕəmran, bayiqina, bayiqina ktowina harke, bayiqina.’ Bakkoye ʕAwanste mḥalaqle ruḥe, hawi kubo w yaʕi.

Till the wezir realized [what happened]. He went and told them, he realized that they were in this thing (in the well), he went and called them. They said: ‘It does not longer make sense in our old age. We have aged a lot, we shall remain here.’ And Bakkoye Avan threw himself [between them], became a thorny bush and grew.
